Sentence.value: Coronary angiography is a procedure that uses a special dye (contrast material) and x-rays to see how blood flows through the arteries in your heart.
Sentence.pattern_crowdsource: [[Coronary angiography|C0085532]] is a [[procedure|C0184661]] that uses a special [[dye|C0013343]] (contrast material) and [[x-rays|C0043299]] to see how blood flows through the arteries in your [[heart|C0018787]].

Sentence.value: - You are going to have surgery on your heart and you are at high risk for coronary artery disease.
Sentence.pattern_crowdsource: - You are going to have [[surgery|C0543467]] on your heart and you are at high risk for [[coronary artery disease|C0010054]].

Sentence.value: - The contrast dye could damage the kidneys (particularly in people with diabetes or prior kidney problems).
Sentence.pattern_crowdsource: - The contrast dye could damage the kidneys (particularly in [[people|C0027361]] with [[diabetes|C0011847]] or prior [[kidney problems|C0812426]]).

Sentence.value: If a blockage is found, your health care provider may perform a percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI) to open the blockage.
Sentence.pattern_crowdsource: If a blockage is found, your [[health care provider|C0018724]] may perform a [[percutaneous coronary intervention|C1532338]] (PCI) to open the blockage.
